metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6872 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
The elf_parse_notes function in elf.c in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.30, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read and segmentation violation) via a note with a large alignment.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6872` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-common - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-for-build - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-for-host - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04

binutils-mipsisa64r6-linux-gnuabin32 - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-mipsisa64r6el-linux-gnuabi64 - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-mipsisa64r6el-linux-gnuabin32 - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-multiarch - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04

No subscription required

notes.Note: ratliff> without ASAN, does not segfault on trusty nor xenial mdeslaur> code is different in xenial, needs backport

criterions.comment: binutils package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.30-20ubuntu2~18.04').
